did.physdesc: Munites, reports, pamphlets, correspondence, photographs, microfilm.
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Included here are the original 1844 Rules, the original manuscript Minute Books kept by the successive secretaries, and contemporary photographs of the Pioneers.

bioghist.p: The Rochdale Society of Equitable Pioneers was founded in 1844 and set the basis for the modern co-operative movement.

The Rochdale Pioneers' co-operative became the prototype for societies in Great Britain. The Rochdale Pioneers are most famous for designing the Rochdale Principles, a set of principles of co-operation that provide the foundation for the principles on which co-ops around the world operate to this day. The model the Rochdale Pioneers used is a focus of study within co-operative economics.

scopecontent.p: Included here are the original 1844 Rules, the original manuscript Minute Books kept by the successive secretaries, and contemporary photographs of the Pioneers.
The Co-operative Union's Librarian briefly summarized the principles of Rochdale Co-operation and their effect upon present day Co-operative movements.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.
